name: 階層線性模式
description:
Hierarchical Linear Models(HLM) is an advanced methodology course. The goal of the course
is to understand the concepts related to HLM; to be able to specify your own models and
analyze the data using one of the HLM related programs; to be able to interpret
the statistical findings to lay persons. The course emphasizes the mastery of concepts,
development of skills in the use and interpretation of HLM software, and the development of
analysis skills for understanding research using multilevel models. Topics include multilevel
data structures, intraclass correlation, model building and testing, effect size, fixed and
random effects, two and three level models, longitudinal models, model assumptions.
goals: to understand the concepts related to HLM
to analyze the data using HLM programs
to interpret the result from HLM programs
syllabus:
### Tentative Schedule

*   01\. Introduction 
*   02\. Getting Started with Multilevel Analysis
*   03\. Multilevel Regression Models(1)
*   04\. Multilevel Regression Models(2)
*   05\. Extending the Two-level Regression Model(1)
*   06\. Extending the Two-level Regression Model(2) 
*   07\. Methods for Examining and Organizational Change(1)
*   08\. Methods for Examining and Organizational Change(2)
*   09\. Multilevel Models with Categorical Variables(1)
*   10\. Multilevel Models with Categorical Variables(2)
*   11\. Multilevel Structural Equation Models(1)
*   12\. Multilevel Structural Equation Models(2)
*   13\. Multilevel Structural Equation Models(3)
*   14\. Multilevel Latent Growth and Mixture Models(1)
*   15\. Multilevel Latent Growth and Mixture Models(2)
*   16\. Multilevel Latent Growth and Mixture Models(3)
*   17\. Data Considerations in Examining Multilevel Models
*   18\. Conclusion

methodologies.note: 因應新冠肺炎疫情，本課程結合非同步數位課程MOODLE系統與同步數位課程TEAM系統，以利課程持續實施。

grading.note: Several homework projects will be planned which will provide a basis for exploring the range of applications available in HLM, gaining experience and facility in running HLM software and interpreting and reporting output.
Participation (come to class, look very happy, and talk about statistical models)
Participation (come to class, look very happy, and talk about statistical models)

The proposal will involve identifying a research question and conducting preliminary literature review, selecting a dataset, and identifying relevant variables. Student should also identify the target journal.
